text: Gilbert Charles Stuart (born Gilbert Charles Stewart December 3, 1755 - July 9, 1828) was an American painter. He was known for painting many portraits of the American Founding Fathers and six Presidents of the United States including George Washington's official portrait. Many of his paintings are in museums in Washington, D.C., London, and in Boston. Stuart died on July 9, 1928 in Boston, Massachusetts from a stroke, aged 72.McLanathan, Gilbert Stuart, p148 ==References== ==Other websites== *Gilbert Stuart at the National Gallery of Art, Washington *Gilbert Stuart Biography, National Gallery of Art *Gilbert Stuart Museum Website *Gilbert-Stuart.org 155 works by Gilbert Stuart *Gilbert Stuart on ArtCyclopedia Category:1755 births Category:1828 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:American painters Category:People from Rhode Island
title: Gilbert Stuart
